javadoc: Background command to create data across a selection inside of a structure.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Constructs a command for applying dataTypes within an existing structure
 across a range of components.
 Simple pointer conversion will NOT be performed.

params.name: addr
params.comment: The address of the existing structure.

params.name: startPath
params.comment: the componentPath where to begin applying the datatype.

params.name: length
params.comment: the number of bytes to apply the data type to.

params.name: dt
params.comment: the datatype to be applied to the range of components.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
This is the same as #CreateDataInStructureBackgroundCmd(Address, int[], int, DataType ) except that
 it allows the caller to control whether or not a pointer data type is created when a 
 non-pointer data type is applied at a location that previously contained a pointer data
 type.

params.name: addr
params.comment: The address of the existing structure.

params.name: startPath
params.comment: the componentPath where to begin applying the datatype.

params.name: length
params.comment: the number of bytes to apply the data type to.

params.name: dt
params.comment: the datatype to be applied to the range of components.

params.name: stackPointers
params.comment:
True will convert the given data type to a pointer if it is not one
 and the previous type was a pointer; false will not make this conversion

name: CreateDataInStructureBackgroundCmd
comment: Background command to create data across a selection inside of a structure.
